articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Greetings to Syrian President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Greetings to Syrian President
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic.
					 The message extended warm congratulations to Bashar Al-Assad and the friendly Syrian government and people on the 53rd anniversary of the March 8 revolution in Syria.
					
					 The March 8 revolution in Syria was a historic event of great significance in the just struggle of the Syrian Arab people for defending the independence of the country and the dignity of the nation, it said.
					
					 It wished the Syrian army and people greater victory in the struggle for frustrating the aggression and terrorism of hostile forces and defending the sovereignty, security and territorial integrity of the country under the leadership of the Syrian president.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Bulgarian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Bulgarian President
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Rosen Plevneliev, president of the Republic of Bulgaria, on the occasion of its national day.
					 Extending warm congratulations to the president and people of Bulgaria, the message wished friendly Bulgaria development and prosperity.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Bulgarian PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Bulgarian PM
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Thursday sent a message of greeting to Boyko Borisov, prime minister of the Republic of Bulgaria, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would steadily grow strong in the interests of the peoples of the two countries, wishing the prime minister success in his work for the country's socio-economic development and prosperity.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to his Bulgarian counterpart Daniel Mitov on the same day.

articles.title: European Politicians Leave
articles.content:
European Politicians Leave
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of politicians from various political parties of Europe led by Chief Executive Officer of Inter Mediate Jonathan Powell, former Downing Street Chief of Staff to Prime Minister Tony Blair, left here on Thursday.

articles.title: Mongolian Delegation Departs for Home
articles.content:
Mongolian Delegation Departs for Home
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Mongolia led by Department Director G. Battungalag left here for home on Thursday.

articles.title: More Mass Rallies Held in Local Areas
articles.content:
More Mass Rallies Held in Local Areas
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Mass rallies took place in North Hwanghae and Jagang provinces, Kaesong City, Pukchang County and other cities and counties on Sunday and Monday to vow to carry out the tasks set forth in the joint calls made by the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and become victors in the 70-day campaign of loyalty.
					 Present there were officials of local party, power and economic bodies and working people's organizations and officials, working people, youth and students of industrial establishments, farms and universities.
					
					 Reporters and speakers recalled that the WPK initiated the 70-day campaign of loyalty to greet its Seventh Congress with high political enthusiasm and unprecedented labor achievements and appealed to the service personnel and people to create fresh spirit representing the Mallima era of Juche Korea and heroic fighting trait in that worthwhile campaign.
					
					 Saying that the 70-day campaign of loyalty is the one for devotedly defending the leader, implementing the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and upholding the Party's policies, they called upon all the units to set high goals of the campaign and dynamically conduct the organizational and political work to give full rein to the masses' revolutionary enthusiasm and creative ingenuity.
					
					 They underscored the need for everyone to bring about miracles and innovations in the campaign, holding higher the red flag of the revolution, and thus make a positive contribution to greeting the Seventh Congress of the WPK as the glorious one of victors.
					
					 Similar rallies took place at the industrial establishments, cooperative farms and universities across the country.

articles.title: KPA Service Personnel Plant Many Trees
articles.content:
KPA Service Personnel Plant Many Trees
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army planted at least 7.1 million trees of good species on Wednesday which marked 70th Tree-planting Day.
					 The trees planted by them included Larix lepolepis, pine-nut trees, Pyongyang maple trees, acacias and fruit trees.

articles.title: Solar Energy Generation System of Korean-style Developed at Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
Solar Energy Generation System of Korean-style Developed at Kim Il Sung University
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Officials and scientists of Kim Il Sung University succeeded in developing the Korean-style solar energy generation system and industrializing the production of equipment for using solar energy.
					 Researchers of the faculties of electronics and automation, physics, life science and material science developed the above-said generation system whereby the whole process of electricity production is controlled by computer.

articles.title: Fishing Campaign Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Fishing Campaign Brisk in DPRK 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Fishing is in full swing on the West Sea of Korea as part of the 70-day campaign now underway in the DPRK.
					 As of today, nearly one hundred fishing boats are seen in the waters off Monggumpho alone, where the number of boats is expected to be doubled.
					
					 Many officials of the Ministry of Fisheries and different fishery stations are directing the fishing campaign on the spot, giving priority to supplying materials like fuel and fishing tools in advance.
					
					 According to Song Chun Sop, vice-minister of Fisheries, officials and fishermen are determined to greet the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea with unprecedented labor feats by reaching the seasonal fishing target without fail.

articles.title: Steel Output on Increase in DPRK
articles.content:
Steel Output on Increase in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Steelworkers across the country have turned out in the 70-day campaign to boost the production in hearty response to the joint calls published by the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) to greet the 7th WPK Congress with unprecedented labor achievements. One of the joint calls is "The Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, the Songjin Steel Complex and the Kangson Steel Complex, add fuel to the flames of increased production!"
					 Increased production has been witnessed at the blast furnace No. 3 of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex by the devoted efforts of workers and technicians.
					
					 The Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, in particular, has over-fulfilled its daily quota 130 percent from the first day of the 70-day campaign. Production of pig iron reaches over 110 percent on a daily average at the oxygen heat-based furnace alone.
					
					 The Chollima Steel Complex has increased rolled steel output 1.5 times year on year since the start of the 70-day campaign. 
					
					 The same is true of the Posan Iron Works, one of Juche iron-producing bases.

articles.title: New Posters Produced
articles.content:
New Posters Produced
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- New posters have been produced in the DPRK to encourage service personnel and people in the 70-day campaign of loyalty to greet the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) as a glorious one of victors.
					 The posters bearing the letters "Let us all become honorary victors in the '70-day campaign' of loyalty!" depict working people all out in the dynamic advance toward May.
					
					 The poster "Party calls on all of us to conduct 70-day campaign!" reflecting the idea of the joint calls of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK appeals to us to create fresh spirit in the era of Mallima in the day and night campaign.

articles.title: 39 Species of Flowers Bred in DPRK
articles.content:
39 Species of Flowers Bred in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Floriculture Institute under the DPRK State Academy of Sciences has made big successes in its work for the past five years.
					 In the period, the institute bred 39 species of flowers, including 6 varieties of cosmos, and established methods of their cultivation.
					
					 It also made great strides in establishing the seed-gathering system of already-bred species as well as methods of their cultivation in all seasons. 
					
					 The institute supplied a large quantity of seeds and flowers to horticultural units under the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection and the Ministry of Urban Management.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il visited the institute in March Juche 100 (2011) and called for paying steady efforts to the floricultural research and putting the cultivation of flowers on a scientific and industrial basis.

articles.title: U.S. Projected Deployment of THAAD in S. Korea Targeted against China and Russia: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Projected Deployment of THAAD in S. Korea Targeted against China and Russia: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is persistently working to deploy THAAD in south Korea under the pretext of "coping with increased ballistic missile threat" from the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. attempt to deploy THAAD is targeted not only against the DPRK but against China and Russia. 
					
					 The commentary discloses the U.S. sinister intention to persistently deploy THAAD in south Korea as follows:
					
					 The U.S. advanced the Asia-Pacific rebalancing strategy a few years ago the keynote of which is to lay a military siege to China and Russia and ward off their influences.
					
					 Pursuant to this strategy, the U.S. is stepping up the arms buildup in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 The U.S. attaches the greatest importance to its deployment of THAAD in south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. chose the southern part of the Korean Peninsula, the neighbor of China and Russia, as a very suitable region for the deployment of THAAD.
					
					 The U.S. is pushing the situation in the peninsula to tension in a bid to find a pretext for deploying THAAD in south Korea at any cost.
					
					 No matter what pretext the U.S. may invent to justify the deployment of THAAD, it can never cover up its sinister intention to neutralize the potential rivals.

articles.title: Despicable Nature of Park Geun Hye Dissected
articles.content:
Despicable Nature of Park Geun Hye Dissected
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Korean woman Ri Su Gyong issued an article dissecting Park Geun Hye in the name of women.
					 The article revealed the despicable nature of Park who experienced no marriage life and has no child and who causes only evils.
					
					 The article continued:
					
					 Park has so far professed the eldest daughter of Park Chung-hee but she had a step-sister from her father's first deserted wife.
					
					 Park Chung-hee abandoned his first wife and her daughter who was his first child but took to Chongwadae only Park Geun Hye and her younger siblings. He tried to put the disgraceful family story under the carpet.
					
					 Park Geun Hye was so cold as to kick her step-sister out when she came to bid last fare-well to her father, ruthlessly violating natural relationships between the father and daughter.
					
					 She brags about her unusual 18-year stay in Chongwadae but it was nightmare-like days crowded with strange events.
					
					 In August 1974 her mother was shot to death and after five years her father was also shot to death by his close confidant.
					
					 No sooner had Park Geun Hye put off her dress for mourning her mother than styled herself the "first lady" in the presence of her father, stunning the world.
					
					 At adolescence she hung out with indecent guys who had been around the dictator.
					
					 She is also called an old hen in south Korea, the article said, deriding her as an abandoned one as she failed to lay eggs and is unable to discern whether she is cock or hen and even crows regardless of time. It went on:
					
					 Incompetence, self-righteousness, arrogance and lack of understanding are her inborn disposition. What she has done at Chongwadae was nothing but the revival of "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 She is a witch who gave south Koreans despair, not hope, and death, not life after becoming "president."
					
					 She can be called "world-level" prostitute as she swings her skirt in the international arena.
					
					 For the purpose of supporting the U.S. policy of pressurizing the DPRK she spent 9 billion U.S. dollars in 2015 only for buying weapons after describing them as latest type ones, though they are too old to use. And she offers tens of billions of U.S. dollars to her American master every year, insisting that she would not take over OPECON from him.
					
					 Being utterly ignorant of military affairs, she introduced at random U.S. nuclear war hardware including nuclear carriers, submarines and bombers into south Korea and even solicited the deployment of THAAD in south Korea. Consequently, the Korean Peninsula has become a theatre of powers' scramble for domination. 
					
					 Not long ago, she committed the high treason of overlooking the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. She is, indeed, a bestial woman to be destroyed by all the Korean women.
					
					 She is a dissipated woman who serves outsiders regardless of time and place and, at the same time, a wicked woman who does everything evil against the compatriots in the north.
					
					 When the whole world hailed the DPRK's successes in the H-bomb test and launch of earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4, she ran amuck together with the fear-stricken U.S. master, committing hideous crimes against reunification.
					
					 Park Geun Hye, pronoun of all crime and disgraces, should be punished in the name of the women all over the world loving justice and truth.

articles.title: S. Korea-Japan "Agreement" on Issue of Sexual Slavery under Fire by South Koreans
articles.content:
S. Korea-Japan "Agreement" on Issue of Sexual Slavery under Fire by South Koreans
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- South Korean people staged actions in various parts of south Korea on March 1 in demand of nullification of the humiliating "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese army.
					 A rally was held at the Chonggye plaza in Seoul under the sponsorship of the national action for nullifying the south Korea-Japan "agreement" on the sexual slavery and its just solution.
					
					 A joint declaration was made public at the rally.
					
					 The joint declaration said the actions would go on until the Japanese government admitted its state and legal responsibility, made an official apology and reparation.
					
					 Similar actions were staged in 24 areas of south Korea including Inchon, Taejon, Jeju Island and Wonju in Kangwon Province of south Korea.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities Accused of Evading Responsibility for Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities Accused of Evading Responsibility for Sexual Slavery 
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Students of Korean University of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and the Union of Korean Students in Japan held a meeting in front of the building of the Japanese foreign ministry Tuesday at which they denounced the authorities for evading the responsibility for the past crimes related to sexual slavery.
					 At the meeting speakers said that Korean students in Japan turned out in the solidarity struggle on the lapse of 97 years since the March First Popular Uprising, timed to coincide with the "day of all-out actions" across south Korea for nullifying the "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 The Japanese government made the unilateral "agreement" with south Korea in utter disregard of the victims of the sexual slavery, an insult to all Koreans, they noted.
					
					 They called on students to play a vanguard role in the struggle to protest against the Japanese authorities' unreasonable discrimination against Korean schools, defend national rights and have the sexual slavery issue settled.

articles.title: Hostile Moves against DPRK Denounced by Chief of Korean Organization in Russia
articles.content:
Hostile Moves against DPRK Denounced by Chief of Korean Organization in Russia
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Jang Sun Jong, chairperson of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, issued a statement on February 23 denouncing the U.S. and other hostile forces for their moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK.
					 The statement said that the DPRK's successful launch of earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4 was a great event of the nation as it instilled strong conviction and courage not only into the people in the homeland but also overseas compatriots and the world progressives.
					
					 The statement accused the U.S., the south Korean puppet forces and the Japanese reactionaries of ratcheting up the pressure upon the DPRK over its legitimate satellite launch.
					
					 It blasted the Park Geun Hye group for totally suspending the operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone and the Japanese authorities for intensifying the politically-motivated suppression of organizations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and the national education and their moves to stamp out it and mulling even the ban on the reentry of Korean residents in Japan after their visits to the homeland.
					
					 The statement also condemned the U.S. imperialist aggressors for moving to deploy THAAD in south Korea.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Celebrated Abroad
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Events took place in Uganda, Iran, Malaysia and Angola on Feb. 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 They included a reading session on Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" at Kitante Primary School in Kampala City of Uganda and round-table talks at the Iran-Korea Friendship Magsal Agro-Stock Farm and a company of Malaysia and a lecture at a company of Angola.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked in UK
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked in UK
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The New Worker, the organ of the New Communist Party of Britain, carried a special write-up on Feb. 12 illustrated with a photo of leader Kim Jong Il to observe his birth anniversary (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 The newspaper said in an article that the Korean people were greatly delighted and excited to hear the news of the successful launch of earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The launch holds greater significance as it was made in the run-up to his birth anniversary.
					
					 He was born in the secret camp on Mt. Paektu during the hard-fought anti-Japanese war grew up to be a great revolutionary.
					
					 He developed and enriched the Juche idea fathered by President Kim Il Sung and thoroughly embodied it in all fabrics of social life.
					
					 After the sudden demise of the President, Kim Jong Il declared that no one should expect any change from him and went through unprecedented harsh trials with which the Korean revolution was faced, leading the Korean people to victory.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups illustrated with portraits of smiling leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of his birth anniversary. 
					 The Lao newspaper Congtap Pasason Lao said in an article that Kim Jong Il is the eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, adding he established the state machinery with the NDC as its pivot, firmly provided a legal guarantee for the Songun politics and thus laid a foundation for the DPRK to prosper forever.
					
					 The Lao newspaper Heng Ngan carried a similar article.
					
					 The Congolese paper Le Patriot in an article noted that the Korean people will glorify the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea, which will be a historical landmark in accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche, as a glorious one of victors.
					
					 The Congolese newspaper La Semaine Africaine carried a special write-up praising the exploits of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 An Angolan paper carried an article praising Kim Jong Il's feats for national reunification.

articles.title: Nigerian Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu Formed
articles.content:
Nigerian Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu Formed
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian preparatory committee for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu was formed in Abuja on Feb. 26.
					 Ibrahim Mantu, member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party and chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association of Nigeria, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary feats and careers of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the struggle of the army and people of the DPRK who turn out in a general offensive for achieving the final victory, and organize colorful political and cultural events on the occasions of the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star (the birth anniversaries of the great leaders) in 2017.

articles.title: Crucial Statement of KPA Supreme Command Hailed by Nigerian Figure
articles.content:
Crucial Statement of KPA Supreme Command Hailed by Nigerian Figure
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Ibrahim Mantu, member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party of Nigeria and chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, on February 26 made public a statement supporting the crucial statement of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army.
					 Noting that the U.S. has gone to the extremes in its hostile policy toward the DPRK to stifle it, he went on:
					
					 Now the U.S. is planning "beheading operation" aiming at the supreme headquarters of a sovereign state.
					
					 I fully support the crucial statement of the KPA Supreme Command as regards the prevailing grave situation and extend firm solidarity to the Korean people.
					
					 The Korean people value the supreme headquarters more than their own lives.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should clearly understand that the Korean people will immediately and mercilessly punish without the slightest leniency, tolerance and patience anyone provoking the dignified supreme headquarters of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should make an apology and put the grave situation under control, though belatedly.

articles.title: Austrian Organization Urges U.S. to Conclude Peace Treaty with DPRK
articles.content:
Austrian Organization Urges U.S. to Conclude Peace Treaty with DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche idea in Vienna, Austria issued a statement on Feb. 25 in support of the crucial statement of the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army.
					 The statement said:
					
					 We bitterly condemn the U.S. and south Korean authorities for their reckless and dangerous moves for invading the DPRK.
					
					 The joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. and south Korean authorities under the signboard of the "annual ones" are the dangerous saber-rattling pushing the situation in the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a war and serious threats to world peace and security.
					
					 Satellite launch is a legitimate right of a sovereign state.
					
					 The successful launch of the earth observation satellite Kwangmyongsong-4 was a clear manifestation of the DPRK's strong national power.
					
					 The U.S. should conclude a peace treaty with the DPRK as soon as possible.

articles.title: Japanese Regime's Moves against DPRK Assailed by Ugandan Organization
articles.content:
Japanese Regime's Moves against DPRK Assailed by Ugandan Organization
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement issued a statement on Feb. 25 in denunciation of the Japanese regime's reckless moves against the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement expresses bitter resentment at the fact that in recent days the Japanese government decided to slap independent sanctions against the DPRK and set about carrying them out.
					
					 The DPRK has the right to develop science and technology for its socio-economic development and ensure security as a sovereign state.
					
					 Nobody is entitled to find fault with it.
					
					 The Japanese government is becoming undisguised in its suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) which plays a role of the diplomatic mission of the DPRK.
					
					 We urge the Japanese government to stop its moves against the DPRK and Chongryon.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities' Moves against DPRK and Chongryon Accused in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities' Moves against DPRK and Chongryon Accused in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, March 3 (LCNA) -- A meeting took place in Dacca, Bangladesh on Feb. 26 to denounce the Japanese authorities' criminal and reckless moves against the DPRK and the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 Present at the meeting were figures of the political parties and organizations such as the Bangladesh People's League, Bangladesh Self-Reliance Research Centre and the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy and other people.
					
					 Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, and other speakers accused the Japanese reactionaries of encroaching upon even the elementary right of Koreans in Japan, finding fault with the DPRK's legitimate satellite launch.
					
					 They urged the Japanese authorities to immediately stop their reckless moves against the DPRK and Chongryon and called for conducting more positive activities for supporting the Korean people in their just cause.
					
					 Adopted at the meeting was a statement.
					
					 The statement reiterated invariable support and solidarity with the Korean people in their just cause of defending the country's sovereignty and security and the resolution to wage more dynamic struggle against the Japanese reactionaries' hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente sirio
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente sirio 
Pyongyang, 3 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, envio el dia 3 un mensaje de felicitacion al Presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad. 
					El texto senala:
					
					En ocasion del 53o aniversario de la Revolucion del 8 de Marzo en Siria, extiendo las felicitaciones cordiales a Vd, al gobierno y pueblo amistosos de vuestro pais.
					
					La Revolucion del 8 de Marzo en vuestro pais fue un acontecimiento historico de gran importancia en la justa lucha del pueblo arabe de Siria por defender la independencia del pais y la dignidad de la nacion. 
					
					Aprovechando esta oportunidad, deseo que bajo la direccion de Vd., el ejercito y pueblo sirios logren mayores exitos en la lucha por defender la soberania, la seguridad y la integridad territorial del pais frustrando la invasion y el terrorismo de las fuerzas hostiles.

articles.title: Continuan mitines multitudinarios en provincias, ciudades y distritos
articles.content:
Continuan mitines multitudinarios en provincias, ciudades y distritos
Pyongyang, 3 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar los dias 28 y 29 del mes pasado en las provincias de Hwanghae del Norte y Jagang, la ciudad de Kaesong, el distrito de Pukchang y otras localidades los mitines multitudinarios para materializar las tareas presentadas en las consignas conjuntas del Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y hacerse triunfadores en la campana de 70 dias de fidelidad. 
					Asistieron los funcionarios de los organismos locales del partido, el poder y la economia, entidades de masas, fabricas, empresas, granjas, universidades y otras unidades, los trabajadores y jovenes de respectivas localidades. 
					
					Los oradores dijeron que el PTC tomo la iniciativa de la campana de 70 dias de fidelidad para acoger el VII Congreso del PTC con elevado entusiasmo politico y exitos laborales sin precedentes y llamo a crear en esta digna campana el nuevo espiritu y el temperamento de lucha heroica que presentan la epoca de Mallima de la Corea de Juche. 
					
					La campana de 70 dias de fidelidad es la de defensa a ultranza al lider, la de materializacion de legados de lider y la de apoyo a las politicas del partido, ratificaron y agregaron que todas las unidades deben elaborar las metas elevadas de la campana de 70 dias y desarrollar ofensivamente las labores politicas y organizativas para poner de pleno manifiesto el entusiasmo revolucionario y la actividad creadora de las masas. 
					
					Llamaron a todos a registrar milagros e innovaciones en la campana de 70 dias de fidelidad enarbolando la bandera roja de la revolucion para contribuir a acoger el VII Congreso del PTC como conclave de triunfadores y de gloria. 
					
					Por otra parte, tuvieron lugar los actos de juramento de empleados en las fabricas, empresas, granjas cooperativas y universidades de todo el pais.

articles.title: Se celebra Dia de Reforestacion en la RPDC
articles.content:
More Mass Rallies Held in Local Areas
 Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Mass rallies took place in North Hwanghae and Jagang provinces, Kaesong City, Pukchang County and other cities and counties on Sunday and Monday to vow to carry out the tasks set forth in the joint calls made by the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and become victors in the 70-day campaign of loyalty.
					 Present there were officials of local party, power and economic bodies and working people's organizations and officials, working people, youth and students of industrial establishments, farms and universities.

					 Saying that the 70-day campaign of loyalty is the one for devotedly defending the leader, implementing the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and upholding the Party's policies, they called upon all the units to set high goals of the campaign and dynamically conduct the organizational and political work to give full rein to the masses' revolutionary enthusiasm and creative ingenuity.
